snippet: Ban Ki-moon, the secretary general, spoke as diplomatic energy was intensifying over a Russian proposal to secure Syria’s chemical weapons stockpiles.
abstract: United Nations Sec Gen Ban Ki-moon says UN is responsible for failure to halt more than two years of atrocious violence in Syria, and expresses hope that the crisis over that country’s chemical weapons stockpile will be catalyst toward diplomatic solution.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and NICK CUMMING-BRUCE
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: Ban Ki-moon, the secretary general, spoke as diplomatic energy was intensifying over a Russian proposal to secure Syria’s chemical weapons stockpiles.

headline.main: U.N. Leader Admits Failure to Halt Syrian Atrocities
headline.print_headline: U.N. Leader Admits Failure to Halt Syrian Atrocities
